name: Citrine Sleet ATT&CK Tactics & Techniques
description: Observed techniques used by Citrine Sleet during analysis of intrusion set's operations.

techniques.comment: Observed with threat actor exploiting vulnerability CVE-2024-38106 in the Windows kernel to achieve sandbox escape post-exploitation of primary payload (CVE-2024-7971).
Citrine Sleet used this technique to identify software that has CVE-2024-7971 to target for exploitation.
According to Microsoft, the suspected way targets were lured to the exploit site voyagorclub[.]space was via social engineering tactics which is a common tactic used by the Citrine Sleet group.
Citrine Sleet communicates with the command and control (C2) server through AES-encrypted connections initiated by the observed loader and remote access trojan (RAT), Kaolin RAT.
The FudModule rootkit was believed to be used by both Citrine Sleet and Diamond Sleet threat actors to establish admin-to-kernel access to Windows devices.

The Diamond Sleet threat group has been observed exploiting known vulnerable drivers to establish admin-to-kernel access to collect sensitive data, using a technique known as Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD).
